rows.label: EB_EN040601_M00_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
The first native Miran indigen encountered
on the continent of Primordia.

rows.label: EB_EN060201_M00_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
Elma's unit dispatched these creatures
outside of NLA's West Gate.
They were severely emaciated after a
prolonged period of poor hunting.

rows.label: EB_EN060201_M00_B_CAPTION
rows.name:
Elma's unit dispatched this creature
outside of NLA's West Gate.
It had been driven out of its territory after
losing a scuffle with another pack.

rows.label: EB_EN040201_M02_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
This indigen pursued the Collepedians who
stumbled into its territory all the way back
to NLA's East Gate, where it was
neutralized by Elma's team.

rows.label: EB_EN020901_M03_F_CAPTION
rows.name:
A Bias captain bearing a profound
hatred toward humanity. Nelson's unit
became the unfortunate victims of his
hateful savagery.

rows.label: EB_EN025001_M04_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
A lead member of the Growth who lives
for violent combat. Her tentacles contain
special boltal organs that allow her to
discharge staggering high-voltage blasts.

rows.label: EB_EN061001_M06_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
This beast confronted Elma's team during
their retrieval of a mysterious Doll in the
depths of Nightglow Forest. It is the largest and
strongest of all tainted indigens.

rows.label: EB_EN010801_M07_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
What it lacks in maneuverability, this Doll
makes up for in firepower. Custom-built
for Goetia, its modified shoulders can fire
powerful boltal salvos.

rows.label: EB_EN025101_M08_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
Another top member of the Growth, with
strength surpassing even that of a Doll.
Dagahn's tremendous mass is covered in a
thick armor plating that absorbs damage.

rows.label: EB_EN025201_M08_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
A Growth commander who can bend
gravity to her will. Cold and vengeful,
she has vowed to eradicate Elma and
her entire team.

rows.label: EB_EN021201_M09_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
This subordinate of Ga-Derg, to whom
he swears absolute loyalty, maintains a
fierce daily regimen of martial training
utilizing both blades and firearms.

rows.label: EB_EN021301_M09_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
This blindingly nimble fighter excels at
close-quarters combat. Her repertoire also
includes the ability to convert atmospheric
ether to heat and then control it.

rows.label: EB_EN025301_M09_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
A fierce warrior who wields both sword
and Doll with stunning mastery. Adverse
to underhanded tactics, he craves a fair
and honest fight above all else.

rows.label: EB_EN025401_M09_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
The right hand of Ga-Derg, and an
adherent of his since childhood. She thinks
only of her master, and her every move is
executed with calculated precision.

rows.label: EB_EN010601_M09_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
Ga-Derg's personal Doll, encountered
by Elma's team in Sylvalum. The ferocity
of the ensuing clash caused fire and
brimstone to rain down on the continent.

rows.label: EB_EN011601_M09_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
Ga Buidhe's personal Doll, encountered
by Elma's team in Sylvalum. Though
engineered as a support unit, its astral
explosion bow wields devastating force.

rows.label: EB_EN011602_M09_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
An all-purpose Doll of Larsian origin
encountered by Elma's team in Sylvalum.
It entered the fray against Ga-Derg's will.

rows.label: EB_EN010701_M10_B_CAPTION
rows.name:
Piloted by Ryyz and Dagahn during their
pursuit of Elma's team. After rampaging
through Sylvalum, its hulking wreckage
now rests amid a pair of great lakes.

rows.label: EB_EN013101_M11_B_CAPTION
rows.name:
A new Doll model developed by BLADE
and eventually stolen by Lao. It's fitted
with equipment that turns traditional
Doll tech on its head.

rows.label: EB_EN010301_M12_B_CAPTION
rows.name:
The fearsome Doll that Elma's team fought
in the Central Life. It lashed out with a
multitude of satellis units, but finally fell
into a grave of protoplasmic fluid.

rows.label: EB_EN010310_M12_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
A satellis unit tasked with defense.
The barrier surrounding it can be
projected over the Vita as well.

rows.label: EB_EN010311_M12_B_CAPTION
rows.name: A satellis unit specializing in offense.

rows.label: EB_EN010312_M12_C_CAPTION
rows.name:
A satellis unit that carries out joint attack
maneuvers with the Vita.

rows.label: EB_EN010313_M12_D_CAPTION
rows.name:
Possessing no offensive capabilities of
its own, this satellis unit specializes in
providing support to both the Vita and
to other satellis units alike.

rows.label: EB_EN010314_M12_E_CAPTION
rows.name:
A satellis unit which homes in on targets
in order to deploy an ether field.

rows.label: EB_EN010315_M12_F_CAPTION
rows.name:
A satellis unit which homes in on targets
and launches counteroffensive measures.

rows.label: EB_EN010316_M12_G_CAPTION
rows.name:
A satellis unit which homes in on targets
and self-destructs after a short countdown.

rows.label: EB_EN061201_M12_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
Synthetic mutants that drive off hostiles
with an arsenal of powerful acid and
flammable gas. Their impulse to destroy
is as strong as their appearance is twisted.

rows.label: EB_EN061101_M12_B_CAPTION
rows.name:
Lao and Luxaar melded with a myriad
of organisms after being saturated in
protoplasmic fluid. Their minds jostle
for dominance within this grotesquerie.

rows.label: EB_EN061201_M12_B_CAPTION
rows.name:
The physical size and mental capacity of
this indigen place it above other chimeras,
which it uses psychic power to control.

rows.label: EB_EN061201_M12_C_CAPTION
rows.name:
Though lacking in both physique and 
intellect, this creature will fight to the
death for the queen chimera.

rows.label: EB_EN061201_M12_D_CAPTION
rows.name:
Though not exceptionally intelligent,
this creature's large girth helps shield
its chimeroid brethren.

rows.label: EB_EN061201_M12_E_CAPTION
rows.name:
This mutant lifeform secretes a unique
pheromone that allows it to enhance
the abilities of other chimeras.

rows.label: EB_EN010801_N_EC00_CAPTION
rows.name:
The Doll of former Growth mercenary
Nahum. Extensive modifications—including
the latest pilot AI—mean that she is the
only one capable of controlling it.

rows.label: EB_EN061202_N_EC00_CAPTION
rows.name:
The only chimera to escape the Lifepoint
Core. Being a hermaphroditic organism,
it roams the planet in search of ample
nourishment to facilitate its reproduction.

rows.label: EB_EN070503_B_N00_CAPTION
rows.name:
This colossal beast awoke for breeding
season after a five-decade slumber beneath
a river of lava. Over 800 years old, it is
considered large, even for a colubrim.

rows.label: EB_EN011901_B_SP00_CAPTION
rows.name:
The most formidable Growth weapon
left after their defeat at the Central Life.
It uses the Vita's satellis units for defense,
and its own strategic units for offense.

rows.label: EB_EN010310_B_SP00_CAPTION
rows.name:
This satellis unit was originally created for
the Vita—the Doll Luxaar used during
the battle inside the Central Life—but
has since been adapted to defend Leva'el.

rows.label: EB_EN041002_W_SP00_CAPTION
rows.name:
An adept jumper, this sabula swallows all
manner of organisms—be they airborne or
underground. As a young male, he needs
extensive nourishment to reach full size.

rows.label: EB_EN041002_W_SP01_CAPTION
rows.name:
Atreides the Distinguished's mate. Sabula
females are larger than males—making her
even deadlier than Atreides. Photosensitive,
she spends most of her time underground.

rows.label: EB_EN070802_W_N00_CAPTION
rows.name:
Unchallenged for supremacy in Sylvalum,
this beast absorbs ether from the nearby
atmosphere, eliminating the need to feed.
It will, however, kill just for sport.

rows.label: EB_EN020606_M_SP00_CAPTION
rows.name:
This peaceful creature lives in the depths
of Nightglow Forest with two ovis companions.
Though normally mild-tempered, harming
his ovis is a surefire recipe for trouble.

rows.label: EB_EN060706_M_SP00_CAPTION
rows.name:
One of Pyotr's two ovis. Energetic and
curious, Heidi will frequently run ahead
of her master, a trait that makes her
especially prone to injury.

rows.label: EB_EN060705_M_SP01_CAPTION
rows.name:
One of Pyotr's two ovis. Unlike Heidi, she
is often seen hiding in Pyotr's shadow.
Although meek, Claire will still make
a valiant stand against trespassing foes.

rows.label: EB_EN070502_M_SP00_CAPTION
rows.name:
This giant millepod has a sensitive spot
that ignites its wrath when touched. It
often gnaws on rocks, with ingested
minerals being stored in its afflicted fin.

rows.label: EB_EN020901_K_EC00_CAPTION
rows.name:
Imprisoned by the Growth for numerous
violent infractions, he slipped away during
the Central Life battle—along with choice
selections from the Growth's armory.

rows.label: EB_EN021014_K_EC00_CAPTION
rows.name:
Their adoration for Dadaan knows no
limits, and their beauty is enough to make
any Bias male do a double take. Now if
only their wits were quite so effective...

rows.label: EB_EN020911_K_EC00_CAPTION
rows.name:
Their love for Dadaan knows no limits,
so they sculpt their bodies to ludicrous
levels, sacrificing speed in the process.
If only their brains matched their bulk...

rows.label: EB_EN060805_K_SP00_CAPTION
rows.name:
This millesaur is infected with a parasite
that makes it both hungry and angry.
Territorial brawls have long-since ruined
the regenerative ability of its false head.

rows.label: EB_EN070901_M_N00_CAPTION
rows.name:
This giant indigen circles the skies of
Nightglow Forest, making its home in the giant
trees there. It's rather unpredictable, and
has even been known to assist BLADEs.

rows.label: EB_EN021108_Q117_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
A Definian who assumed the guise of Miia.
Her deception was undone, however, when
she was unable to replicate Miia's quirky
personality.

rows.label: EB_EN013201_Q131_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
A Doll used by one of the Celeste Three.
It has been customized with enhanced
attack specs in order to dispatch trapped
foes with ruthless efficiency.

rows.label: EB_EN013201_Q131_B_CAPTION
rows.name:
A Doll used by one of the Celeste Three.
It has been customized with enhanced
attack specs in order to dispatch trapped
foes with ruthless efficiency.

rows.label: EB_EN013201_Q131_C_CAPTION
rows.name:
A Doll used by one of the Celeste Three.
It has been customized with enhanced
attack specs in order to dispatch trapped
foes with ruthless efficiency.

rows.label: EB_EN011501_Q132_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
A subordinate of the mysterious black
Doll that was looking for Bates.

rows.label: EB_EN013205_Q140_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
A Doll specializing in long-range attacks.
It was used by the culprit who sniped
Eliza and fled.

rows.label: EB_EN013202_Q143_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
Alex's Doll, fitted with a potent selection
of firepower to fulfill his goal of purging
all xenoforms.

rows.label: EB_EN020901_Q150_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
An especially cruel Bias who hunted
down humans, dismantling their still-
operational Blue Bloods for parts to
build weapons.

rows.label: EB_EN013211_Q151_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
A Doll belonging to Justin, aka the Blood
Lobster. It's powered by a mix of stolen
human tech and Definian innovation, and
far surpasses even BLADE's latest models.

rows.label: EB_EN013210_Q251_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
A Doll piloted by Powell, Army Pizza's
owner and culprit in a string of Ma-non
murders. It razes everything in its path,
like a pizza oven with a fiery vendetta.

rows.label: EB_EN011501_Q259_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
A Doll of the Definian who disguised
herself as Fraisie and claimed to be the
manifestation of a god. She deceived and
used all those who trusted in her.

rows.label: EB_EN020911_Q302_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
A Cavern Clan Bias who wreaked many
an atrocity alongside his younger sibling,
Mujiba. He protected the key to the room
imprisoning Oll Valdileo.

rows.label: EB_EN020912_Q303_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
A Cavern Clan Bias who wreaked many
an atrocity alongside his older sibling,
Ajiba. He protected the key to the room
imprisoning Rada Valdileo.

rows.label: EB_EN020901_Q306_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
Before coming to Mira, the warrior Galba
Vassago defeated many enemy generals.
He now uses this strength to protect the
futures of promising young Bias.

rows.label: EB_EN013204_Q312_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
A high-performance Doll belonging to
Leroy. Customized by its owner with the
utmost care in order to protect the object
of his affection, Lavina.

rows.label: EB_EN020902_Q312_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
Warrior of the Tree Clan, and father
to Lavina. His much-lauded exploits
include felling countless members of
the Cavern Clan.

rows.label: EB_EN060702_Q351_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
An extremely battle-competent suid kept
by Zarch Quokett. The term "odsent"
means "he who opens the future" in
ancient Bias.

rows.label: EB_EN021001_Q356_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
A Cavern Clan member who serves as
Team Slovity's leader. A Growth trap
tricked her into donning a suit that drove
her mad with rage.

rows.label: EB_EN011107_Q356_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
A Galdr piloted by the series of Definians
known as the Megisia. Its unparalleled
transformative powers leave foes dazed—
thus its nickname, "Mist Charmer."

rows.label: EB_EN011803_Q357_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
A Seidr piloted by MG068: Megisia, the
youngest sister in the Megisia series of
Definians. This Doll has been upgraded
more than those piloted by her siblings.

rows.label: EB_EN020701_Q411_B_CAPTION
rows.name:
A BLADE operative from the Landbankers
Union. He paid the ultimate price after
running away with Zazazan's cargo.

rows.label: EB_EN060602_Q422_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
The Divine Nopopon after having been
transformed by a burst of spiritual energy.

rows.label: EB_EN050502_Q422_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
The Divine Napopon after having been
transformed by a burst of spiritual energy.

rows.label: EB_EN050201_Q422_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
The Divine Nipopon after having been
transformed by a burst of spiritual energy.

rows.label: EB_EN040503_Q422_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
The Divine Nupopon after having been
transformed by a burst of spiritual energy.

rows.label: EB_EN021202_Q501_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
Go Belg's disciple. A highly intelligent
warrior with a keen strategic eye, his
power is most apparent when fighting
alongside the mighty Gi Ziordo.

rows.label: EB_EN021203_Q501_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
Go Belg's disciple. A warrior blessed with
astonishing physical strength, his power is
most apparent when fighting alongside the
stoic Gi Ziorde.

rows.label: EB_EN021203_Q502_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
Princess of the House of Zo. In spite of her
social standing, she's walked the warrior's
path since childhood, wielding the sword
of her deceased brother as she fights.

rows.label: EB_EN011602_Q504_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
A Caladar piloted by De Sazon. Its tough
frame commands the awe-inspiring
majesty of a Larsian father.

rows.label: EB_EN011602_Q504_B_CAPTION
rows.name:
A Caladar piloted by De Soghu. Its tough
frame emanates the unyielding love of
a Larsian mother.

rows.label: EB_EN011602_Q504_C_CAPTION
rows.name:
A Caladar piloted by De Ezich. This Doll's
mostly unused condition speaks to the lax
training habits of its pilot.

rows.label: EB_EN011602_Q506_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
A Caladar piloted by Da Naguth. Swift as
the wind, those who stand against it are
quickly reduced to a dizzy stupor.

rows.label: EB_EN011602_Q506_B_CAPTION
rows.name:
A Caladar piloted by Da Girhi. Foes
barring the way forward are cleanly
run through by ranged attacks that
are as powerful as lightning.

rows.label: EB_EN011602_Q506_C_CAPTION
rows.name:
A Caladar piloted by Da Zeulbe.
Getting close is a death wish, for it
can reduce boulders to rubble with
a single mighty swipe.

rows.label: EB_EN011602_Q509_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
A Doll piloted by a Larsian warrior
with embarrassingly fluffy ears. Though
she lacks confidence in her combat skills,
her Doll proficiency is actually top-notch.

rows.label: EB_EN021302_Q513_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
A Larsian spy who betrayed Adolphus,
stealing his white gold. It seems she had
a legitimate reason for needing fast cash...

rows.label: EB_EN021001_Q515_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
A Cavern Clan warrior and leader of
Team Slovity. She possesses exceptional
strength, even by Bias standards.

rows.label: EB_EN020710_Q515_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
The Definian Erio, who passed herself
off as Gwin in order to enter the
Larsian Battle Gauntlet.

rows.label: EB_EN011602_Q515_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
A Caladar belonging to a three-time
champion of the Larsian Battle Gauntlet.
This Doll wields jaw-dropping strength in
spite of it being a mass-produced model.

rows.label: EB_EN021106_Q551_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
The Definian perpetrator of Sun'celeg's
murder. She had been ordered to abduct
Orphean scientists.

rows.label: EB_EN013205_Q601_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
Roselle's Doll, customized for a fortune.
Though she hoped to bury her past sins
along with BLADE corpses, her plan was
foiled and the Doll ruined beyond repair.

rows.label: EB_EN021104_Q651_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
An elite Definian tasked with the
protection of Fortun.

rows.label: EB_EN021111_Q652_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
The eldest sister of the trio that helms the
Definian race. She, along with Fortun,
has commanded the Definians for ages.

rows.label: EB_EN021112_Q652_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
The middle sister of the trio that helms the
Definian race. Violence is her supreme joy,
and many of her "little sisters" based on
her design have the same inclinations.

rows.label: EB_EN021113_Q652_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
The youngest sister of the trio that helms
the Definian race. Her juvenile personality
rings true in her actions, never hesitating
to take a life in service of her greed.

rows.label: EB_EN010501_Q652_B_CAPTION
rows.name:
The ultimate battle unit, wrought from
Fortun's knowledge and the vast store
of weapons amassed by Definian hands
over time.

rows.label: EB_EN021101_Q654_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
A Definian spy working for the Growth.
She infiltrated NLA disguised as
Clemons.

rows.label: EB_EN013207_Q702_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
A Doll used by Gadd's underlings.
Its offensive capabilities were scheduled
for an overhaul paid for with the fortune
made from Doctor B's kidnapping.

rows.label: EB_EN013207_Q703_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
The Doll belonging to the Avalancher, Dolba.
Nicknamed "The Wrecking Doll" for its
tendency to reduce foes to pieces, it was,
ironically, itself wrecked upon its defeat.

rows.label: EB_EN020705_Q703_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
A BLADE member of the Testamenters
Union who was after Doctor B's
hyper technology.

rows.label: EB_EN021110_Q754_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
A Definian who disguised herself as
Tolba Wolfen in order to steal alien
weaponry for the Growth.

rows.label: EB_EN021201_Q755_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
The last surviving member of the Hundred
Hellions—an elite Larsian battalion.
He learned to split himself into three via a
skill known as the Threefold Thunderflash.

rows.label: EB_EN021107_Q804_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
A Definian who served under Fortun.
Her field experience for the Growth
consisted mostly of reconnaissance, leaving
her combat skills somewhat lacking.

rows.label: EB_EN020710_Q855_B_CAPTION
rows.name:
An Interceptor who underwent a training
program compiled by Elma in order to
reinforce his skills as a BLADE. He seeks
greater strength to win Irina's favor.

rows.label: EB_EN021114_Q906_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
A Definian who posed as a Bias mother.
She disappeared after Bozé Lowes taught
her not to mess with a man of faith.

rows.label: EB_EN020909_Q908_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
A Bias ruffian and devourer of countless
Nopon. Notorious for skewering his prey
alive—shocking behavior even for a
member of the Cavern Clan.

rows.label: EB_EN013209_Q916_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
A Doll belonging to Otis, who was
cajoled into attacking Irina's team by
the Murderess. Unfortunately for him,
he was well and truly routed.

rows.label: EB_EN013208_Q918_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
The Doll of Dale Gibbon, a psychopathic
murderer responsible for the deaths of the
Murderess's parents. Its powerful array of
weapons helped to satisfy Dale's bloodlust.

rows.label: EB_EN013203_Q919_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
Supplied by Sakuraba Industries for testing
purposes, this Doll sustained catastrophic
damage during a trial run.

rows.label: EB_EN021102_Q923_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
A Definian who transformed herself
into Himeri Aranji, exploiting her fame
to abduct humans and steal their
Blue Blood components.

rows.label: EB_EN010201_Q564_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
Invented by an Orphean called Tan'celeg
to keep watch over humans and their
property, this revolutionary security
mechanism requires no pilot.

rows.label: EB_EN010204_Q515_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
The brainchild of Tan'celeg and Veven,
this automated security marvel is powered
by the technological genius of both the
Orphean and Ma-non races.

rows.label: EB_EN021301_Q509_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
This Larsian warrior has the most
delightful pair of fluffy ears—a trait
that she rather dislikes...

rows.label: EB_EN730101_M13_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
Many unlucky BLADEs at the south
coast base camp fell victim to these
entities. Thankfully, Elma and her
crew were able to fend them off.

rows.label: EB_EN710101_M13_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
The Vita, using the Ares's cores.
After a skirmish with Elma's squad,
it departed the frontlines, followed
by a harassing flock of Ghosts.

rows.label: EB_EN730201_M14_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
Just as things were looking grim for
poor Omomo at the Delusians North
Summit, Elma and co. stepped in to
turn the tables on this menace.

rows.label: EB_EN060503_M14_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
A simius found and fought in the
Canopied Nightwood for a sample of
its genetic material. Elma was,
predictably, successful in this task.

rows.label: EB_EN710101_M15_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
Void's physical vessel, the Vita
intercepted Elma as she made land
on Volitaris. Afterwards, her team
was scattered across the continent.

rows.label: EB_EN780101_M15_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
Void, fought on Volitaris. Before he
could warp to another dimension,
Elma and her crew were able to
reclaim the cores he'd stolen.

rows.label: EB_EN780101_M15_B_CAPTION
rows.name:
Void, during the second and final
phase of the battle on Volitaris.
In the end, he learned the meaning
of "death" and ceased to be.

rows.label: EB_EN719100_Q931_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
The Ares, as fought during a mock
battle, proposed by Al to test your
strength. To everyone's relief, you
passed with flying colors.

rows.label: EB_EN060701_Q932_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
Hunted by Al's squad at Sayram
Lake, this rare breed of suid was
the source of the meat needed to
make Smile Pizza's pepperoni.

rows.label: EB_EN779100_Q928_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
Manufactured in secret, Kelemen's
Hraesvelg-type Doll attacked, and
was promptly subjugated by, Liesel
and her stalwart friends.

rows.label: EB_EN013001_Q929_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
One of a pair of unidentified Dolls
who attacked Neil during her survey
of one of Valley of Oblivion's giant rings. Upon
defeat, it swiftly disappeared.

rows.label: EB_EN013002_Q929_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
One of a pair of unidentified Dolls
who attacked Neil during her survey
of one of Valley of Oblivion's giant rings. Upon
defeat, it swiftly disappeared.

rows.label: EB_EN013001_Q930_A_CAPTION
rows.name:
A Doll battled at O'rrh Sim Keep,
designed to keep interlopers away.
Dispatched, to everyone's relief, by
Neil and her BLADE escorts.
